mdRecord.dcterms:title: Stonewall Jackson statue, general view
mdRecord.dcterms:creator: Ezekiel, Moses Jacob (American sculptor, 1844-1917) [work]
Wilson, Richard Guy [photographer]
mdRecord.dcterms:publisher: Rector and Visitors of the University of Virginia
mdRecord.dcterms:description: Stonewall Jackson Statue (1912). A replica of Sir Moses Ezekiel's monumental sculpture which was first created for the United Daughters of the Confederacy to commemorate Confederate General and former Professor at VMI, Thomas Jonathan "Stonewall" Jackson. Ezekiel had marched under Jackson's leadership as a cadet and was part of the honor guard that attended the General's coffin during his funeral. Jackson is depicted surveying the field before the Battle of Chancellorsville, VA where he received his mortal wound. The sculpture was unveiled on June 19, 1912 and stands in front of the cadet Barracks inscribed with the words "The Institute will be heard from today." -- http://www.vmi.edu/Archives/FAQs/Statues,_Monuments,_Cannon_FAQ/ [work]
